1:
We have heard with our ears, God,
\q our fathers have told us
\q what work you did in their days,
\q in the days of old.
\q
2:
You drove out the nations with your hand,
\q but you planted our people;
\q you afflicted the peoples,
\q but you spread our people out in the land.
3:
For they did not obtain the land for their possession by their own sword,
\q neither did their own arm save them;
\q but your right hand, your arm, and the light of your face,
\q because you were favorable to them.
\q
4:
God, You are my King;
\q command victory for Jacob.
6:
For I will not trust in my bow,
\q neither will my sword save me.
7:
But you have saved us from our adversaries,
\q and have put to shame those who hate us.
\q
8:
In God we have made our boast all the day long,
\q and we will give thanks to your name forever.
\qs Selah\qs*
9:
But now you have thrown us off and brought us dishonor,
\q and you do not go out with our armies.
\q
11:
You have made us like sheep destined for food
\q and have scattered us among the nations.
13:
You make us a rebuke to our neighbors,
\q scoffed and mocked by those around us.
\q
14:
You make us an insult among the nations,
\q a shaking of the head among the peoples.
15:
All the day long my dishonor is before me,
\q and the shame of my face has covered me
\q
16:
because of the voice of him who rebukes and insults,
\q because of the enemy and the avenger.
\q
17:
All this has come on us; yet we have not forgotten you
\q or dealt falsely with your covenant.
19:
Yet you have severely broken us in the place of jackals
\q and covered us with the shadow of death.
\q
20:
If we have forgotten the name of our God
\q or spread out our hands to a strange god,
\q
21:
would not God search this out?
\q For he knows the secrets of the heart.
\q
22:
Indeed, for your sake we are being killed all day long;
\q we are considered to be sheep for the slaughter.
23:
Awake, why do you sleep, Lord?
\q Arise, do not throw us off permanently.
\q
24:
Why do you hide your face
\q and forget our affliction and our oppression?
26:
Rise up for our help
\q and redeem us for the sake of your covenant faithfulness.
44:
\m
\d For the chief musician. A psalm of the sons of Korah. A maschil.
\q
